0: Who is this that obscures my plans with words without knowledge? Brace yourself like a man; I will question you, and you shall answer me - Job 38:2-3
1: Where were you when I laid the earth's foundation? Tell me, if you understand - Job 38:4
2: Therefore I have uttered what I did not understand, things too wonderful for me, which I did not know - Job 42:3
3: Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered - Psalm 32:1
4: Behold, you delight in truth in the inward being, and you teach me wisdom in the secret heart - Psalm 51:6
5: But I am poor and needy; hasten to me, O God! You are my help and my deliverer; O Lord, do not delay! - Psalm 70:5
6: Transgression speaks to the wicked deep in his heart; there is no fear of God before his eyes - Psalm 36:1
7: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge, but fools despise wisdom and instruction - Proverbs 1:7
8: Father of the fatherless and protector of widows is God in his holy habitation - Psalm 68:5
9: The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want - Psalm 23:1
10: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, from the words of my groaning? - Psalm 22:1
11: As for me, I have set my King on Zion, my holy hill - Psalm 2:6
12: Oh give thanks to the LORD; call upon his name; make known his deeds among the peoples! - Chronicles 16:8
13: Oh give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his steadfast love endures forever! - Psalm 107:1
14: Bless the LORD, O my soul! O LORD my God, you are very great! You are clothed with splendor and majesty - Psalm 104:1
15: They will perish, but you will remain; they will all wear out like a garment. You will change them like a robe, and they will pass away - Psalm 102:26
16: In distress you called, and I delivered you; I answered you in the secret place of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah - Psalm 81:7
17: I will remember the deeds of the LORD; yes, I will remember your wonders of old - Psalm 77:11
18: For he sees that even the wise die; the fool and the stupid alike must perish and leave their wealth to others - Psalm 49:10
19: The fool says in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt, they do abominable deeds; there is none who does good - Psalm 14:1
20: In the pride of his face the wicked does not seek him; all his thoughts are, "There is no God" - Psalm 10:4
21: My help comes from the LORD, who made heaven and earth - Psalm 121:2
22: I lift up my eyes to the hills. From where does my help come? - Psalm 121:1
23: For this I will praise you, O LORD, among the nations, and sing to you name - Psalm 18:49
24: He raises up the poor from the dust; he lifts the needy from the ash heap to make them sit with princes and inherit a seat of honor - 1 Samuel 2:8
25: The LORD makes poor and makes rich; he brings low and he exalts - 1 Samuel 2:7
26: The LORD kills and brings to life; he brings down to Sheol and raises up - 1 Samuel 2:6
27: Talk no more so very proudly, let no arrogance come from your mouth; for the LORD is a God of knowledge, and by him actions are weighed - 1 Samuel 2:3
28: There is none holy like the LORD: for there is none besides you; there is no rock like our God - 1 Samuel 2:2
29: In those days there was no king in Israel. Everyone did what was right in his own eyes - Judges 21:25
30: Have I not commanded you? Be strong and courageous. Do not be frightened, and do not be dismayed, for the LORD your God is with you - Joshua 1:9
31: Do you thus repay the LORD, you foolish and senseless people? Is not he your father...who made you and established you? - Deuteronomy 32:6
32: Know, therefore, that the LORD your God is not giving you this good land to possess because of you righteousness, for you are a stubborn people. - Deuteronomy 9:6
33: Know then in your heart that, as a man disciplines his son, the LORD your God disciplines you - Deuteronomy 8:5
34: You shall love the LORD your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might - Deuteronomy 6:5
35: Hear, O Isreal: The LORD our God, te LORD is one - Deuteronomy 6:4
36: So teach us to number our days that we may get a heart of wisdom - Psalm 90:12
37: The LORD bless you and keep you, the LORD make his face to shine upon you and be gracious to you - Numbers 6:25
38: Then the LORD said to him, "Who has made man's mouth? Who makes him mute, or deaf, or seeing, or blind? Is it not I, the LORD? - Exodus 4:11
39: My ears have heard of you but now my eyes have seen you. Therefore I despise myself and repent in dust and ashes - Job 42:5-6
40: Will the one who contends with the Almighty correct him? Let him who accuses God answer him! - Job 40:2
41: How then can a mortal be righteous before God? How can one born of woman be pure? - Job 25:4
42: I know that my redeemer lives, and that in the end he will stand on the earth - Job 19:25
43: Would it turn out well if he examined you? Could you deceive him as you might deceive a mortal? - Job 13:9
44: If he holds back the waters, there is drought; if he lets them loose, they devastate the land - Job 12:15
45: It is all the same; that is why I say, 'He destroys both the blameless and the wicked - Job 9:22
46: His wisdom is profound, his power is vast. Who has resisted him and come out unscathed? - Job 9:4
47: ...casting all your anxieties on him, because he cares for you - 1 Peter 5:7
48: And now, little children, abide in him, so that when he appears we may have confidence and not shrink from him in shame at his coming - 1 John 2:28
50: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God - John 1:1
51: All things were made through him, and without him was not any thing made that was made - John 1:3
52: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it - John 1:5
53: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, yet the world did not know him - John 1:10
54: And the Word became flesh and dwelt among us, and we have seen his glory, glory as of the only Son from the father, full of grace and truth - John 1:14
55: For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ - John 1:17
56: "Meaningless! Meaningless!" says the Teacher. "Utterly meaningless! Everything is meaningless - Ecclesiastes 1:2
57: Generations come and generations go, but the earth remains forever - Ecclesiastes 1:4
58: All things are wearisome, more than one can say. The eye never has enough of seeing, nor the ear its fill of hearing - Ecclesiastes 1:8
59: Is there anything of which one can say, "Look! This is something new?" It was here already, long ago; it was here before our time - Ecclesiastes 1:10
60: For with much wisdom comes much sorrow; the more knowledge, the more grief - Ecclesiastes 1:18
61: Yet when I surveyed all that my hands had done...everything was meaningless, a chasing after the wind - Ecclesiastes 1:11
62: The wise have eyes in their heads, while the fool walks in the darkness; but I came to realize that the same fate overtakes them both - Ecclesiastes 2:14
63: What do people get fore all the toil and anxious striving with which they labor under the sun? - Ecclesiastes 2:22
64: I know that everything God does will endure forever; nothing can be added to is and nothing taken from it - Ecclesiastes 3:14
65: Much dreaming and many words are meaningless. Therefore fear God Ecclesiastes 5:7
66: The more the words, the less the meaning, and how does that profit anyone? - Ecclesiastes 6:12
67: Extortion turns a wise person into a fool, and a bribe corrupts the heart - Ecclesiastes 7:7
68: Do not say, "Why were the old days better than these?" For it is not wise to ask such questions - Ecclesiastes 7:10
69: Wisdom makes one wise person more powerful than ten rulers in a city - Ecclesiastes 7:19
70: Then I saw all that God has done. No one can comprehend what goes on under the sun - Ecclesiastes 8:17
71: Now there lived in that city a man poor but wise, and he saved the city by his wisdom. But no one remembered that poor man - Ecclesiastes 9:15
72: So then, banish anxiety from you heart and cast off the troubles of your body, for youth and vigor are meaningless - Ecclesiastes 11:10
73: Fear God and keep his commandments, for this is the duty of mankind - Ecclesiastes 12:13
